TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit TimeSpanValidator extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationValidatorBase

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class is used to ensure that a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object meets specific criteria. The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with two parameters ensures that both a minimum and a maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> value are adhered to. The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with three parameters checks both the minimum and maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> values, as well as whether the validation range is exclusive. The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with four parameters checks the previous three parameters and also checks whether the <xref:System.TimeSpan> value is equal to a specific number of seconds.
The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.CanValidate%2A> method determines whether the object type being validated matches the expected type. The object being validated is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor with two parameters is used, the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> object validates that a <xref:System.TimeSpan> value adheres to a specific range.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.%23ctor%2A> constructor checks both the minimum and maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> values, as well as whether the validation range is exclusive. When the `rangeIsExclusive` parameter is set to `true`, the <xref:System.TimeSpan> value must not be between the `minValue` and `maxValue` values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the `resolutionInSeconds` parameter is specified, the <xref:System.TimeSpan> object being validated must be equal to this value in order to pass validation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> object contains the rules necessary to validate a <xref:System.TimeSpan> object. The rules are established when an instance of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class is created. The object to validate is passed as a parameter of the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator.Validate%2A> method. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Configuration.TimeSpanValidator> class.
